```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```



```{r}
## read in BA Excel file
# Install and load the readxl package if not already installed
if (!require(readxl)) {
  install.packages("readxl")
}
library(readxl)

# Define file paths
path_attributes_gpa <- "/Users/andrewedwards/Downloads/BA Data 3/BA Major Students - Attributes and GPA.xlsx"
path_credit_hours <- "/Users/andrewedwards/Downloads/BA Data 3/BA Major Students - Credit Hours.xlsx"
path_degrees_awarded <- "/Users/andrewedwards/Downloads/BA Data 3/BA Major Students - Degrees Awarded.xlsx"
path_grades_updated <- "/Users/andrewedwards/Downloads/BA Data 3/BA Major Students - Grades -updated.xlsx"
path_grades <- "/Users/andrewedwards/Downloads/BA Data 3/BA Major Students - Grades.xlsx"
path_majors <- "/Users/andrewedwards/Downloads/BA Data 3/BA Major Students - Majors.xlsx"
path_students <- "/Users/andrewedwards/Downloads/BA Data 3/BA Major Students.xlsx"

# Read each file into a data frame
df_attributes_gpa <- read_excel(path_attributes_gpa)
df_credit_hours <- read_excel(path_credit_hours)
df_degrees_awarded <- read_excel(path_degrees_awarded)
df_grades_updated <- read_excel(path_grades_updated)
df_grades <- read_excel(path_grades)
df_majors <- read_excel(path_majors)
df_students <- read_excel(path_students)


```
```{r}
# Check the structure and summary for each data frame
str(df_attributes_gpa)
str(df_credit_hours)
str(df_degrees_awarded)
str(df_grades_updated)
str(df_grades)
str(df_majors)
str(df_students)

# Basic summary statistics using summary() or skim() for each data frame
summary(df_attributes_gpa)
summary(df_credit_hours)
summary(df_degrees_awarded)
summary(df_grades_updated)
summary(df_grades)
summary(df_majors)
summary(df_students)

```
```{r}
# Check for missing values in each BA data frame
sapply(df_attributes_gpa, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))
sapply(df_credit_hours, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))
sapply(df_degrees_awarded, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))
sapply(df_grades_updated, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))
sapply(df_grades, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))
sapply(df_majors, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))
sapply(df_students, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))

```
